When working with a user on Bug 86926, he got the following exception.  I'm not
sure if it's just a corrupt download/install or something more significant.

http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/I-Daniela_2-200503011230/index.php)
but I cannot get it to run. It points me to a log file at:

Could you check two things?  One, could you try downloading the build again to
make sure the download wasn't corrupted.  Two, could you make sure that the
install was unzipped into a new directory (i.e., not on top of an existing install).

Deja vu. I just tried I20050308-0835 to see if 86926 had been fixed and got the
same error than last time. I completely removed the old integration build and
I'm 100% sure that the installation is clean. There are no plug-ins installed,
just the SDK.

I cannot reopen this issue here, but I hope that when you get this message you will.

Felipe, did the fix not make it into the build?

The change was incomplete. Every argument in a calback must be int /*long*/, 
including the return value. I've released it in HEAD.

int /*long*/ setDirectionProc (int /*long*/ widget, int /*long*/ direction)

When's the next integration build, so I can try to reproduce both bug #87010 and
bug #86926?

I think this integration build is being rebuilt for this fix (and others), so it
might be later today...

Yes - a rebuild I200503081510 was requested and the fix should make its way 
through the final integration build. Closing for now...
